revised_title: The Function and Gradations of the Tricuspid Valve in Mammalia and Birds
tldr: J. W. King investigates the function of the tricuspid valve in the right ventricle of the heart in humans and various mammals and birds. He demonstrates that the tricuspid valve serves as a safety valve, allowing for the reflux of blood into the auricle during varying states of distension. The degree of this function varies among different animal orders, with humans exhibiting a very conspicuous manifestation.
